item.title: Setting Req for Prayer SkillCape and Prayer hood
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

Go in item4.java and add the item id’s in the right spot. ( to get them to wield right just add like the prayer cape in the cape int.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 06, 2008, 06:56:10 PM[/size][hr][code][code][code]public int GetCLPrayer(int ItemID) {
if (ItemID == 14085) {
return 99;
}
if (ItemID == 14086) {
return 99;
}
if (ItemID == 14087) {
return 99;
}
String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID);
if (ItemName.startsWith(“monk”)) {
return 99;
}
if (ItemName.startsWith(“Prayer Cape(t)”)) {
return 99;
}
return 1;
}

[/code]

There is your fixed code.[/code][/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Setting Req for Prayer SkillCape and Prayer hood
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

Mine is in a different form and it works like this :

public int GetCLPrayer(int ItemID) {
if (ItemID == 14085) {
return 99;
}
if (ItemID == 14086) {
return 99;
}
if (ItemID == 14087) {
return 99;
}
String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID);
if (ItemName.startsWith(“Prayer cape”)) {
return 99;
}
if (ItemName.startsWith(“Prayer hood”)) {
return 99;
}
return 1;
}

Maybe try replacing your code with this, and putting in the item ID’s.

Read full topic

Currently I created a CLprayer code.

public int GetCLPrayer(int ItemID) { if (ItemID == -1) { return 1; } String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID); if (ItemName.startsWith("monk")) { return 99; } if (ItemName.startsWith("Prayer Cape(t)")) { return 99; } return 1; }

^^ It looks like that.

That code doesn’t work though.

I need some help here I can’t do this…
